6923.description: Responses indicative of intrusion—LMHost file download, certain banners, Metasploit Meterpreter kill command detected, etc.

8213.description: These are auto-generated from several sources of known and confirmed active Botnet and other Command and Control hosts. Updated daily, primary data source is Shadowserver.org.

9254.description: These are auto-generated from several sources of known and confirmed active Botnet and other Command and Control hosts. Updated daily, primary data source is Shadowserver.org. This set is grouped by destination-port.

2005.description: Identification of traffic related to numerous chat clients, irc, and possible check-in activity

12647.description: Collective Intelligence generated IP rules for blocking based upon cinsscore.com.

11428.description: Active and short lived campaigns. This category covers exploit kits and malware that will be aged and removed quickly due to the short lived nature of the threat.

2857.description: Rules for attacks and vulnerabilities regarding DNS. Also category for abuse of the service for things such as tunneling.

147.description: Denial of Service attempt detection. Intended to catch inbound DOS activity, and outbound indications.

14175.description: IP based rules for Dshield Identified attackers. Daily updated list of the DShield top attackers list.

8970.description: Exploits that are not covered in specific service category. Rules to detect direct exploits.

9983.description: Rules for attacks, exploits, and vulnerabilities regarding FTP. Also includes basic none malicious FTP activity for logging purposes, such as login, etc.

4108.description: Rules to log HTTP protocol specific events, typically normal operation.

8284.description: Rules for the identification, as well as attacks and vulnerabilities regarding the IMAP protocol.

11902.description: Malware and Spyware related, no clear criminal intent.

11709.description: Specific to mobile platforms: Malware and Spyware related, no clear criminal intent.

2473.description: Rules for the identification, as well as attacks, exploits and vulnerabilities regarding Netbios. Also included are rules detecting basic activity of the protocol for logging purposes.

159.description: Rules for the identification of Peer-to-Peer traffic and attacks against. Including torrents, edonkey, Bittorrent, Gnutella, Limewire, etc.

8709.description: Application Identification category. Includes signatures for applications like DropBox and Google Apps, etc. Also covers off port protocols, basic DLP such as credit card numbers and social security numbers.

10863.description: Rules for the identification, as well as attacks and vulnerabilities regarding the POP3 protocol. Also included are rules detecting basic activity of the protocol for logging purposes.

1938.description: RPC related attacks, vulnerabilities, and protocol detection. Also included are rules detecting basic activity of the protocol for logging purposes.

8385.description: Rules for attacks, exploits, and vulnerabilities regarding SMTP. Also included are rules detecting basic activity of the protocol for logging purposes.

14312.description: Rules that will log SMTP operations.

3187.description: Rules for attacks, exploits, and vulnerabilities regarding SNMP. Also included are rules detecting basic activity of the protocol for logging purposes.

9829.description: Rules for attacks, exploits, and vulnerabilities regarding SQL. Also included are rules detecting basic activity of the protocol for logging purposes.

4409.description: Rules for attacks and vulnerabilities regarding the TELNET service. Also included are rules detecting basic activity of the protocol for logging purposes.

14971.description: Rules for attacks and vulnerabilities regarding the TFTP service. Also included are rules detecting basic activity of the protocol for logging purposes.

9007.description: Rules for matching on TLS events and anomalies.

6927.description: IP Based rules for the identification of traffic to and from TOR exit nodes.

8179.description: Malicious software that has clear criminal intent. Rules here detect malicious software that is in transit, active, infecting, attacking, updating, and whatever else we can detect on the wire.

11939.description: Rules for attacks and vulnerabilities regarding the VOIP environment.

13217.description: Web client side attacks and vulnerabilities.

4033.description: Rules for attacks and vulnerabilities against web servers.

4642.description: Traffic indicative of network based worm activity.
